If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.19-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** Exploratory **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.78+ck92725@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome **App Component:** User Settings ## Action Performed: Precondition: User logged in with gmail account & has created new workspace 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Navigate to WS settings >> Workflows >> Make & track payments 3. Add VBA (Regions bank) going through plaid flow 4. Navigate to Accounts >> Wallet >> click Enable wallet 5. Go through the enable wallet flow 6. Tap on Transfer balance option 7. Observe blank popup displayed ## Expected Result: Transfer balance page RHP (or if popup appears, it should display relevant info) should be displayed when wallet has added business bank account ## Actual Result: Blank popup on selecting Transfer balance option when BA has only Business bank account. Issue happens when wallet has only business bank account Note: If bank account has both Personal BA & Business BA, transfer balance RHP opens as expected on selecting transfer balance option. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0d5ef31e-6718-42f4-82aa-4cf099cfbc64 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.19-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-962/folder/13176670/41237099/920382469 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1852@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace available. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create a manual expense. 4. Create a new report but donÂ´t add any expense to it. 5. Navigate to "Reports" 6. Open the expense created on step 3. 7. Tap on report field and select the report created on step 4. 8. Return to "Reports" and open the report where the expense was moved. 9. Scroll to the top of report. 10. Tap on the "New Messages" badge. 11. Note that same report is reopened. 12. Tap on the arrow on the top left corner. 13. Note that you land on the same report again. ## Expected Result: Tapping on the "New Messages" badge on report, should redirect to the last message on the expense report. ## Actual Result: Tapping on the "New Messages" badge on report, after changing the report of an expense. reopens the same report again, and the user has to close it twice to return to "Reports". ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0d8b2d1c-fa58-49ed-b4ee-00a62084b15d [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
